abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Inner Mongolia Highway
            Project for China were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: simplified internal clearance procedures
            for variation orders. The approval of the different has led
            to long delays in finalizing contracts. A simplified yet
            efficient internal clearance procedure in Inner Mongolia is
            needed to streamline the approvals process between multiple
            agencies and to avoid long delays. Reduced use of
            International supervision for shorter, more specific
            technical tasks. Construction supervision under local
            engineering firms was supported by an international
            consultant firm and four consulting staff was relocated to
            the construction site. It was found that the international
            consultant provided good project management and quality
            control support but lacked sufficient knowledge of Chinese
            standards and technical challenges. As construction quality
            in China is generally high and implementation periods
            satisfactory, it is recommended to use international
            consultants only for shorter, more specific technical tasks
            and to make more use of local consultants that are familiar
            of the Chinese standards and technical practices. In the
            planning of transport investments it is important that there
            is good coordination between various modal agencies. During
            the preparation stage more emphasis could have been given to
            the linkages between road and rail movements with the
            objective of improving integration in planning and
            operations and greater inter-modal efficiencies.

5086386.trustfund:
TF038740-CHINA - PREPARATION OF INNER
            MONGOLIA HIGHWAY PROJECT,TF038822-CHINA - PREPARATION O FJAIANGXI
            II, II AND INNER MONGOLIA,TF030802-JAPAN CTF - FY06 GENERAL: INF
            (INFRASTRUCTURE NETWORK)
5086386.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Rural development,Trade and integration

abstracts.cdata!:
The Inner Mongolia Highway Project aims
            at improving the efficiency, safety, and cost-effectiveness
            of the transport infrastructure, to support the development
            of the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region, by improving
            accessibility to its poorer areas, and reducing the
            region's socioeconomic disparity. The main components
            include: 1) construction of the Laoyemiao-Jining highway
            (LJH) - a divided four-lane, access controlled toll highway
            - which as part of the national highway network, and
            critical within the east-west corridor in the region, will
            connect the key industrial, administrative, and hub cities
            of Baotou, Hohhot, and Jining. Supply of equipment,
            electrical installation, lighting systems, and construction
            supervision will be financed, based on environmental
            criteria established prior to commencement of civil works;
            2) a highway network improvement program for poverty areas,
            establishing that sections to be constructed should link the
            poor to the developed areas in the province, based on
            established monitoring and performance indicators; 3)
            highway safety program, as per detailed engineering designs,
            that include installation of traffic safety facilities; and,
            4) institutional strengthening, and training, enhanced
            through technical assistance provision for project
            preparation, road maintenance programs, and engineering research.

1787040.trustfund:
TF038822-CHINA - PREPARATION O FJAIANGXI
            II, II AND INNER MONGOLIA,TF038740-CHINA - PREPARATION OF INNER
            MONGOLIA HIGHWAY PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
China - Inner Mongolia Highway Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Inner Mongolia Highway Project
            encompasses rehabilitation and construction works of the
            Laoyemiao - Jining highway, a main artery among the national
            highway network. The scope and criteria of this
            environmental assessment covers both a social assessment,
            and the ecological aspects potentially affected by the
            project implementation. The following is a summary of the
            environmental impacts, and mitigation measures. During
            construction, trees in the right of way (ROW), and forestry
            - particularly for soil conservation and protection of
            irrigation systems - will be avoided as possible; spoil
            sites with no impact on farmland, or natural vegetation will
            be reduced, by lowering embankments, to be later
            rehabilitated along with local agriculture development
            activities; spraying of storage material, and asphalt mixing
            sites should prevent air, and dust pollution; and,
            wastewaters, and oil spills discharges will be prevented
            from river flows, treated appropriately, aiming as well to
            prevent soil erosion, and irrigation contamination. Drainage
            ditches will be designed so as to prevent flooding, and
            water losses, and contain soil erosion. Traffic safety
            measures shall include adequate signs, and road
            diversification as needed; while limited working days
            activities should minimize noise disturbances.

Summary of environmental assessment and
            action plan (revised)

1695586.trustfund:
TF038822-CHINA - PREPARATION O FJAIANGXI
            II, II AND INNER MONGOLIA,TF038740-CHINA - PREPARATION OF INNER
            MONGOLIA HIGHWAY PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
China - Inner Mongolia Highway Project :
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Inner Mongolia Highway Project
            encompasses rehabilitation and construction works of the
            Laoyemiao - Jining highway, a main artery among the national
            highway network. The scope and criteria of this
            environmental assessment covers both a social assessment,
            and the ecological aspects potentially affected by the
            project implementation. The following is a summary of the
            environmental impacts, and mitigation measures. During
            construction, trees in the right of way (ROW), and forestry
            - particularly for soil conservation and protection of
            irrigation systems - will be avoided as possible; spoil
            sites with no impact on farmland, or natural vegetation will
            be reduced, by lowering embankments, to be later
            rehabilitated along with local agriculture development
            activities; spraying of storage material, and asphalt mixing
            sites should prevent air, and dust pollution; and,
            wastewaters, and oil spills discharges will be prevented
            from river flows, treated appropriately, aiming as well to
            prevent soil erosion, and irrigation contamination. Drainage
            ditches will be designed so as to prevent flooding, and
            water losses, and contain soil erosion. Traffic safety
            measures shall include adequate signs, and road
            diversification as needed; while limited working days
            activities should minimize noise disturbances.

docna.cdata!: Initial environmental evaluation and action plan

display_title.display_title:
China - Inner Mongolia Highway
            Project : environmental assessment : Initial environmental
            evaluation and action plan
